text: Russell School, also known as Cain's School, is a historic Rosenwald school located near Durham, Durham County, North Carolina. It was built in 1926–1927, and is a one-story, front-gabled weatherboarded building. It features a center projecting wing containing the original industrial room, flanking recessed entrances, and two large classrooms. The school closed in 1945 and has been owned by Cain's Chapel Baptist Church and used as a community center. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2009. ==References== Category:African-American history of North Carolina Category:School buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Rosenwald schools in North Carolina Category:School buildings completed in 1927 Category:Buildings and structures in Durham County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Durham County, North Carolina Category:1927 establishments in North Carolina
title: Russell School (Durham, North Carolina)
